I hate to imagine what music and subcultures there will be when I'm about your age.

I hate to imagine what music and subcultures there will be when I'm about your age.

 
 One can only imagine. I can assure you that we never saw any of what currently exists coming down the pike. So only God knows what fads will show up in the future.

That's why I hate Cradle of Filth, because they're Gothic wussies who make people think that emo kids listen to metal. Emo isn't metal, if most emo kids listened to metal, their brains would leak out their ears.
 
 Gothic kids mostly listen to symphonic metal bands (posers) like Cradle of Filth while emo and scene kids normally listen to emo bands like Green Day or Fallout Boy. Those bands are weak, IMO. I have nicknames for those bands but I don't think this is the appropriate place to use them.

Actually I'm optimistic about these subcultures.
 
 You see, it started out with punks. Punks evolved into goths, goths evolved into emos, and emos evolved into scene kids. Hopefully, the scene kids will evolve into chimps and the chimps will evolve into humans. :)

Calling these kids "emo" is actually sort of a misnomer. Almost none of these so-called emo kids listen to actual emotional hardcore. Even that Hawthrone Heights band that they all seem to listen to is more pop-punk than emo.
 
 I personally respect the wussy "emos" more than I respect the ones who go around trying to act tough. At least the less macho-acting emos realize that dying their hair and whining about how nobody loves them doesn't make them look tough.
 
 I laugh at pretty much anyone who thinks their subculture makes them tough (e.g. punks, wiggers, some scenesters, etc.)
